result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Lamont Shurn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: with 5 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
Cash bail on deposit to be applied.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.

Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: STRAIGH TIME, stayed.  Sentence to be imposed at the discretion of the officer.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Lamont Shurn

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
PSI reviewed and corrections made.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: 

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 5 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 5 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- 1 month condition time STRAIGH TIME, stayed.  Sentence to be imposed at the discretion of the officer.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
Cash bail on deposit to be applied.  
Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Jury trial date of 8/31/15 is ordered vacated.

Defendant Michael Lamont Shurn in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for final pre-trial.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Michael Lamont Shurn in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 8/7/2015 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 8/31/2015 at 9:00 am.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Michael Lamont Shurn in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Atty. Kastenson is leaving the public defenders office. Court grants Atty. Kastenson's Motion to Withdraw. Case calendared for STATUS of COUNSEL on 5/29/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Michael Lamont Shurn in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Paul Hauer for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM019940  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/14/2015

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael Lamont Shurn in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4-16-2015 at 1:30pm
